article.title: Multipartite entanglement and quantum Fisher information in conformal field theories

multiple_choice_question.text: **A. What is the main topic of this scientific article?**
choices: Calculation of bipartite entanglement entropy in 1+1 dimensional classical field theories.
Relationship between multipartite entanglement and quantum Fisher information in quantum field theories, particularly conformal field theories.
Derivation of the c-theorem in 1+1 dimensions using quantum Fisher information.
Analysis of the localizable entanglement in non-conformal but scale invariant systems.

multiple_choice_question.text: **B.  What does the inequality FQ[Pk-prod] > []² + (N-L」)², tell us about a system of N particles with spin ½?**
choices: It determines the exact value of k-partite entanglement.
It provides a lower bound for the variance of parameter θ.
It establishes a sufficient condition for the presence of useful k+1-partite entanglement.
It relates the quantum Fisher information to the system\'s bipartite entanglement entropy.

multiple_choice_question.text: **C. What is the significance of the smallest scaling dimension in the context of quantum Fisher information and multipartite entanglement?**
choices: It plays a negligible role in determining the multipartite entanglement content.
It dictates how the density of quantum Fisher information scales with the system size, directly relating to the multipartite entanglement.
It is solely relevant in the study of bipartite entanglement entropy.
It has no correlation with the divergence of entanglement measures in quantum field theories.

multiple_choice_question.text: **D. Under what conditions does the smallest scaling dimension (∆) increase under Renormalization Group (RG) flow based on one-loop calculations in diagonal 1+1 CFTs?**
choices: When the structure constants (C) are both positive or both negative.
Regardless of the sign of the structure constants.
When the RG flow leads to a trivial CFT.
